name: Fast HB
description: Going for a fast advanced HB based on a lot of the new cards from Second Thoughts. I'm going for a strictly Operation based econ and hopefully scoring some early agendas and using their abilities to score things even faster.

name: Rielle, the Zen Trickster
description: Basically a Rielle deck with late-game tricks like Femme Fatale and Parasucker, comments welcome.

name: Passive Economy v1.0
description:
Grifter, Underworld Contact, Daily Casts, Desperado, Professional Contacts, Compromised Employee. All passive economy, no Clicks needed: you do your thing, they provide you money. As such, I think Gabriel Santiago is the Identity you really want, instead of Andromeda, due to the extra income it provides.

Grifter is a card for a very aggressive playstyle, so it's better to have plenty of Run type events as well, just to keep you on the move. Account Syphon, Dirty Laundry, Inside Job, Running Interference and The Maker's Eye... plus Sneakdoor Beta which makes you run as well.

There is no recycle, due to lack of influence for it, mainly. But in a deck that aims at running every single turn, you should finish the game before you run out of cards.

name: Reina Roja's Grand Theft
description: A Credit Denial deck for Reina Roja, with extensive Caissa usage and support by Parasucker and Darwin. Caissa are not autonomous in runs, and I have to get confident with the tactic before being able to free some slots from overabundant breakers. First deck of this kind for me, came up with that in about 30 minutes and imediately after rebuilding once again my Rielle deck, so please don't be cruel, comments welcome.

name: Shaper typical
description: Typical shaper

name: fast wey
description: Fast way to weyland

name: The new Anarch
description: This is the approach I would start with. The idea is slow down there econ by making them pay out the ass for the Ice they do rez. Then, trash it. If they trash either Knight or Rook then, they are helping you out. Pawn will get them back, just not sure how the whole process will work. Hence only one of.

name: Modern Faerush
description:
Economy through SMC and Faerie installs using Scheherazade, discounts on other breakers (they cost 1 to install with hera!).

Cheap breaks, tinkering brings costs down when you just use Faerie to break hadrians wall :P Even troubleshooter has issues, since they either spend a lot to get over your cheap costs, then they're broke, or they don't trash your programs!

Lots of recursion for the faeries...but if your rig gets trashed, no big deal! They're cheap to install and easy to find back.

Nothing costs a lot to install (deus X being the most expensive non resource, and procontacts being the 5 coster of doom). The prepaid voicepads make sure gambles and dirty laundries all the more lucrative. If you use them, there's 9 of each using levy, and levy is only 2 to play if you have all your voicepads out. The more stuff you have installed before a levy the more dense the credit event draw becomes.

The great thing about this deck is that its aggressive, and its a threat even after closed accounts. It doesn't care too much about program trashing, if you have to lose your corroder to get through a grim on a maker's eye run, go for it.

Only possible change is hera for grifter, depends on if I can always make a run per turn, 2 free credits is nothing to sneeze at (consider how with prepaidPad getting you 5 for 0 cost, and activating some grifters would be like a 7-8 credit gain on a successful run!)

Of course squeezing in plascrete for that whole thing is also a big deal. I thought about -2 hera +1 decoy (crash space for more utility) +1 tinkering for the scorched fears.

-2 hera +2 crescentus to go along with all the recursion, you can plug up grims and archers and save yourself faeries, and cost the corp lots of cash for no thing!

I would love to hear feedback on these options, and playtest results!

name: Weyland - Power Shutdown -  lets trash corroder!
description:
The idea here is pretty simple - Almost every competitive runner runs some of the following: corroder, AI breakers, Faerie, SMC.

Faerie, SCM and Corroder are probably the best targets for Power shutdown. Having 10 sentries serves to cause too many targets for recurring faerie alone.

AI-only suites would be pretty resilient to this idea, so there is swordsman. Also serves as punishment for early aggression.

Power shutdown might be risky, but if milling 2 cards means that they cant break barriers, its probably worth it. Jackson for draw power and to save your ass from milled agendas.

name: Jinteki the blade
description: Aggressor

name: Reina: Mala Runner
Reina Siphon
Reina: Ice Destruction
Mac & Cheese 2.0
Kate Darwin v2
description: Added a sacrificial construct in order to prevent trashing due to swordman meta

name: Gabepire Mala tempora update
description:
Utilize the pheromones interaction with vamp. Use gorman drip to kick them while they're down. Added Better breakers, Running interference, 1 more sneakdoor (convinced me to switch to gabe). Needs some sort of R&D punish though. Gabe gets you those 2 extra credits per turn that is just too hard to say no to over andromeda's ~13 credit starting bankroll (double suregamble = 13, SG+easy mark =12). Gives the trick more staying power.

If you suspect a purge upcoming, let your pheromones refresh 1 time without using them, just spend a turn drawing and getting bonus econ, because the credits don't disappear when the corp purges. Also makes for a good opportunity to install more pheromones!

Grifter ended up not fitting very well, but I might still try it. Running interference is good for when you have to play shapery and get your pheromones up first. Helps you get counters on them after a purge too, and plays off same old thing if you prefer that to siphon. Overall it helps the goal of running HQ often, and doesn't force you to run if you don't want to like grifter does. Though, grifter should work well with the overall goal anyway. So we'll see.

For those who might not see the running interference power, after siphoning and vamping, you can use it to run the remote, which will have very few, if any rezzed ice, since you spend all game wrecking HQ and archives->HQ. Pheromones work on traces, trashing assets in HQ (even through the sneakdoor), and for breakers.

Cyberfeeder might help, but at the cost of vamps or Djinns...or good breakers, I just can't find the slots.

name: Knights of Kitdonia
description:
First iteration of (yet another) Kitty Kit deck. This time she brought her chivalrous friends!

The idea behind this deck was born while playing at a bunch of local tournaments, and realizing that:

a Corp against Kit has some serious economical problems, as it has to fortify with at least two ICEs any important server (HQ, R&D, Scoring remote); Cyber-cipher is, literally, a BEAST: it can pierce ANY first-ICE with very little money; Once the Corp ICEs the most important servers, you have to transition to a full rig. Albeit Shapers have lots of drawing and tutoring, this will take a little time, opening a few scoring windows for the Corp; Femme Fatales are really great for BIG ICEs (I'm calling you Weyland!)... but what about "middle ground" ICEs? Breaking an expensive ICE for 1-2 credits each turn can be tempting, but at times it is not worth the 9 credit investment.

So, taking into account these notes, I saw a possible solution in Mala Tempora: the Knights. A good universal breaker, quite inexpensive at two credits, tutorable mid run (and installable thanks to Deep Red), and capable of making ANY server not at-least three ICE deep absolutely unsafe for the Corp. Add to the mix the recycling properties of the Shapers, and you have an easily adaptable, furious, cheap, run machine :) (add Scavenge to the mix to remap the singleton Femme, the Cyber-ciphers and the Knights)

DISCLAIMER: For the moment this is a proof-of-concept. This deck hasn't seen ANY tabletop (or OCTGN) time, so take precautions, and if you manage to test it before I do, report your findings! :)

name: HepatitvsJs Interns (Accelerated Diagnostics combo) v1.0
description: Rework= Accelerated Diagnostics. Sea Source= Power Shutdown. Foxfire= Interns. OK. I think I finally broke Accelerated Diagnostics. Best case scenario, runner never even gets a turn. Start. 5 creds, 3clicks. Install JackHo, $5/2cliks. Power shutdown, $4/1clik. Accelerated Diagnostics after JackHo puts an interns, archived memories and biotic labor in R&D. Interns puts JackHo back in play, archived memories puts AD back in hand and biotic labor gives you two clicks. Alternate between biotic labor and hedge fund to get "infinite clicks and money. Repeat with interns, AM, and Shipment from San San occasionally using another interns to put and agenda in play as well as JackHo. Openly weep because Netrunner finally hit the combo silliness of MtG. :(

name: Jackson Howards Interns (Accelerated Diagnostics combo)
description: -2 profiteering, -1 restructure. +1 interns, +1 archived memories, +1 Project Ares. Interns and archived memories are needed to get JackHo back in case runner trashes him. Biotic labor, interns (JackHo), shutdown, AD is the back up plan.

name: Ambush Net v1.1
Mac & Cheese 2.1 (even more generalist edition)
description: added source and replaced yog and mimic with gord and creep in order to be able to stop nbn fast which this deck was weak against

description: Sea Source=Power Shutdown Rework=Accelerated Diagnostics. Ok...After the embarrassment of my last PS+AD deck I'm posting this one and hoping to redeem myself. >_
